page.title: 03BURTON SALMON FARMS 1
page.content:
BYRAM ESTATE FARM
Mr Macloy's farm is called Byram Estate. The land is better than some, but it still needs a lot of work and fertiliser. The main crops are barley, wheat, rape and potatoes. There are 4000 pigs, 75,000 ducks, 20 cows and 14 horses. The pigs and ducks are reared in sheds. There are 8,500 ducks in each shed. The cows were out to pasture and the horses are a hobby. There is one combine harvester and 12 tractors with many trailers and attachments. He has 24 employees on his farm. Mr Macloy's main problems currently are vandalism, theft and subsidence, which causes drainage problems.
